an4.9:1: "Bhikkhus, there are these four ways in which craving arises in a bhikkhu. What four? Craving arises in a bhikkhu because of robes, almsfood, lodgings, or for the sake of life here or elsewhere.[n.636]Itthabhāvaññathābhāvaṁ.Mp:"Life here" is this existence(ayaṁ attabhāvo); "life elsewhere" is a future existence(anāgatattabhāvo).These are the four ways in which craving arises in a bhikkhu."
an4.9:2: With craving as companiona person wanders during this long time.Going from one state to another,he does not overcome saṁsāra.
an4.9:3: Having known this danger—that craving is the origin of suffering—free from craving, devoid of grasping,a bhikkhu should wander mindfully.
